cluster_relations.rel_desc: Blurring the line between fact and fiction in stories influences listeners’ questioning of the existence of the supernatural.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The subject affects the audience's belief or questioning regarding the existence or reality of the object.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: AudienceEffect: prompts questioning of reality of supernatural phenomena

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The authenticity of urban legends determines or reflects the truth behind the stories.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject affects, shapes, or constrains the nature, degree, or assessment of the object.

args.justification: Both relations express that one abstract or conceptual property (blurring fact/fiction; authenticity of urban legends) shapes or affects another conceptual state (belief in the supernatural; truth behind stories). Using a single, more general class 'conceptual_influence_relation' consistently across them avoids over-narrow specialization for belief-specific cases while preserving their shared causal-influence semantics.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations express that one abstract or conceptual property (blurring fact/fiction; authenticity of urban legends) shapes or affects another conceptual state (belief in the supernatural; truth behind stories). Using a single, more general class 'conceptual_influence_relation' consistently across them avoids over-narrow specialization for belief-specific cases while preserving their shared causal-influence semantics.
